verses.verse: A Psalm of Asaph. O God, the nations have come into Your inheritance; they have defiled Your holy temple; they have laid Jerusalem in heaps.
They have given the bodies of Your servants as food for the birds of the heavens; the flesh of Your godly ones to the beasts of the earth.
They have shed their blood like water all around Jerusalem, and there is no one burying.
We have become a shame to our neighbors a scorn and a mockery to those who are around us.
Until when, O Jehovah? Will You be angry with us forever? Shall Your jealousy burn like fire?
Pour out Your wrath on the nations who have not known You, and to the kingdoms who have not called on Your name.
For they have eaten up Jacob and laid waste to his dwelling-place.
Do not remember for us the former sins of our fathers; let Your tender mercies meet us speedily, for we have been greatly weakened.
Help us, O God of our salvation, for the matter of the glory of Your name; and deliver us and cover our sins, for Your name's sake.
Why should the nations say, Where is their God? Let Him be known among the nations before our eyes, the avenging of the blood of Your servants that has been poured out.
Let the groaning of the prisoner come before You. According to the greatness of Your arm, preserve the sons of death.
And turn back to our neighbors sevenfold. Give into their bosom their reproach with which they have reproached You, O Lord.
And we Your people and sheep of Your pasture will give thanks to You forever; we will declare Your praise to generation and generation.
